root_causes: Missing entry condition: the script does not restrict output to test mode (expected entry_conditions includes isTest()).
No validation implemented for the sub-variables (HidA1ARPIS_1 .. HidA1ARPIS_5) even though the question metadata specifies numeric/open-text attributes and limits for the components.
instructions: Apply the specified entry condition so this check runs only in test mode. For example, before listing results add: temporary. sel if isTest(). (Place the sel if/isTest() selection prior to any list or validation statements.)
If you intend to validate the computed components, add explicit checks for each sub-variable. Example checks for the individual components (adapt codes/ranges as appropriate):

Repeat similar checks for HidA1ARPIS_2 .. HidA1ARPIS_5 (e.g., sel if miss(HidA1ARPIS_2) or ~range(HidA1ARPIS_2,2,2) if each sub-variable must equal its single answer code; otherwise use the appropriate allowed range or numeric validation).

If the components are numeric with precision/limits (as in the metadata), implement numeric range/precision checks instead of exact-code checks (for example, check lower/upper bounds with ~range(variable, lower, upper) and flag values exceeding allowed precision or limits).
If you intentionally do not want any validation because the variable is derived, keep a comment stating that and still enforce the entry condition (isTest()) so the listing only appears in test mode.
